paper_abstract: The Gutman index (also known as Schultz index of the second kind) of a graph G is defined as Gut(G) = Sigma(u,v is an element of V(G))d(u)d(v)d(v)d(u, v). We show that; among all graphs on it vertices, the star graph S-n has minimal Gutman index. In addition, we present upper and lower bounds on Gutman index for graphs with minimal and graphs with maximal Gutman index.
